experiment.name: Transcription profiling by array of Arabidopsis heterozygous mutant for gh3.5 after inoculation with Pseudomonas syringae pv tomato DC3000(avrRpt2) against wild type counterparts and uninfected controls

description.text: To reveal the underlying molecular mechanism of GH3.5 action in modulating the SA and auxin pathways, we performed transcriptional profiling of gh3.5-1D plants after infection with or without Pst DC3000(avrRpt2) on a global scale using the Affymetrix Arabidopsis ATH1 GeneChip Experiment Overall Design: Each 3 leaves of plants of 5-week-old wild type Columbia-0 and mutant gh3.5-1D (heterozygous) were inoculated with Pst DC3000(avrRpt2)at 105 cfu mL-1. Leaves were harvested at 0 h (uninoculated) and 48 hours after inoculation. Three biological repeats were performed on Columbia-0 (wild-type, Col-0) and gh3.5-1D (mutant) after infection with or without Pst DC3000(avrRpt2), respectively.

bibliography.authors: Zhongqin Zhang, Qun Li, Zhimiao Li, Paul E Staswick, Muyang Wang, Ying Zhu, Zuhua He
bibliography.title: Dual regulation role of GH3.5 in salicylic acid and auxin signaling during Arabidopsis-Pseudomonas syringae interaction.
